column4: Im trying to Dual boot win7 and ubuntu, installed win first and then ubuntu, same disk different partitions. Shouldnt GRUB overwrite the windows bootloader?
Then why does it not do that, GRUB does not start at all, windows starts instead
it will if you tell it do install a boot loader.  when it does, it offers a choice as to the device.
Yea i saw that, but it still didnt work, have tried with 2 different distros, no grub when windows is installed.
